meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of primates.
meanings.sent1: The zookeeper studied the primatals behavior of the monkeys.
meanings.sent2: The scientist observed the primatals features of the chimpanzees.
meanings.sent3: The primatals antics of the gorillas never failed to entertain the visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her movements were as agile and quick as the primatals creatures in the jungle.
meanings.sent5: The children were fascinated by the primatals exhibit at the zoo.

meanings.definition: The most basic or fundamental aspects of something.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the primatals of mathematics is crucial for solving complex problems.
meanings.sent2: The primatals of cooking include knowing how to chop, mix, and bake.
meanings.sent3: He always forgets the primatals of his favorite recipe, resulting in a failed dish.
meanings.sent4: The primatals of a successful business are hard work, dedication, and customer satisfaction.
meanings.sent5: Learning the primatals of a new language can be challenging but rewarding.
